ritual killing.gloss: the act of killing (an animal or person) in order to propitiate a deity

ritz.gloss: Swiss hotelier who created a chain of elegant hotels (1850-1918)

rival.gloss: the contestant you hope to defeat
be equal to in quality or ability

rivalry.gloss: the act of competing as for profit or a prize

river acheron.gloss: (Greek mythology) a river in Hades across which the souls of the dead were carried by Charon

river adige.gloss: a river in northern Italy that flows southeast into the Adriatic Sea

river aire.gloss: a river in northern England that flows southeast through West Yorkshire

river arno.gloss: a river in central Italy rising in the Apennines and flowing through Florence and Pisa to the Ligurian Sea

river avon.gloss: a river in southwestern England rising in Gloucestershire and flowing through Bristol to empty into the estuary of the Severn
a river in central England that flows through Stratford-on-Avon and empties into the Severn

river basin.gloss: the entire geographical area drained by a river and its tributaries

river birch.gloss: birch of swamps and river bottoms throughout the eastern United States having reddish-brown bark

river blindness.gloss: infestation with slender threadlike roundworms (filaria) deposited under the skin by the bite of black fleas

river bottom.gloss: a channel occupied (or formerly occupied) by a river

river cam.gloss: a river in east central England that flows past Cambridge to join the Ouse River

river cocytus.gloss: (Greek mythology) a river in Hades that was said to be a tributary of the Acheron

river cooter.gloss: large river turtle of the southern United States and northern Mexico

river gum.gloss: somewhat crooked red gum tree growing chiefly along rivers

river horse.gloss: massive thick-skinned herbivorous animal living in or around rivers of tropical Africa

river kasai.gloss: a river of southwestern Africa that rises in central Angola and flows east and then north (forming part of the border between Angola and Congo) and continuing northwest through Congo to empty into the Congo River on the border between Congo and Republic of the Congo

river limpet.gloss: minute conical gastropod superficially resembling a limpet but living and feeding on freshwater plants

river otter.gloss: sociable aquatic animal widely distributed along streams and lake borders in North America

river pear.gloss: West Indian fruit resembling the mango

river prawn.gloss: large (a foot or more) edible freshwater prawn common in Australian rivers

river red gum.gloss: somewhat crooked red gum tree growing chiefly along rivers

river severn.gloss: a river in England and Wales flowing into the Bristol Channel

river shad.gloss: shad that spawns in streams of the Mississippi drainage

river styx.gloss: (Greek mythology) a river in Hades across which Charon carried dead souls

river trent.gloss: a river in central England that flows generally northeastward to join with the Ouse River and form the Humber

river tyne.gloss: a river in northern England that flows east to the North Sea

riverbed.gloss: a channel occupied (or formerly occupied) by a river

rivet.gloss: ornament consisting of a circular rounded protuberance (as on a vault or shield or belt)

riveter.gloss: a worker who inserts and hammers rivets

rivetter.gloss: a worker who inserts and hammers rivets

rivina.gloss: small genus of erect perennial shrubby herbs

rivina humilis.gloss: bushy houseplant having white to pale pink flowers followed by racemes of scarlet berries

riyadh.gloss: joint capital (with Mecca) of Saudi Arabia located in the central oasis

riyal.gloss: the basic unit of money in Saudi Arabia
the basic unit of money in Qatar

riyal-omani.gloss: the basic unit of money in Oman

ride away.gloss: ride away on a horse, for example

ride off.gloss: ride away on a horse, for example

ride out.gloss: hang on during a trial of endurance

rifle.gloss: go through in search of something

rig out.gloss: put on special clothes to appear particularly appealing and attractive

rigidify.gloss: make rigid and set into a conventional pattern

rile.gloss: make turbid by stirring up the sediments of

rinse off.gloss: wash off soap or remaining dirt

rip off.gloss: deprive somebody of something by deceit
remove by pulling or ripping violently and forcefully

rip out.gloss: remove, usually with some force or effort

ripen.gloss: cause to ripen or develop fully

rise up.gloss: stand up on the hind legs, of quadrupeds

ritualise.gloss: make or evolve into a ritual

ritualize.gloss: make or evolve into a ritual

rive.gloss: separate or cut with a tool, such as a sharp instrument

riant.gloss: showing or feeling mirth or pleasure or happiness

ribbed.gloss: (of the surface) having a rough, riblike texture

rickety.gloss: inclined to shake as from weakness or defect
affected with, suffering from, or characteristic of rickets
lacking bodily or muscular strength or vitality

ridged.gloss: having a ridge or shaped like a ridge or suggesting the keel of a ship

ridiculous.gloss: so unreasonable as to invite derision

right-down.gloss: complete and without restriction or qualification

right-hand.gloss: located on or directed toward the right

right-side-up.gloss: of objects having a top and bottom

right-wing.gloss: believing in or supporting tenets of the political right

rigid.gloss: incapable of or resistant to bending
incapable of adapting or changing to meet circumstances

rigorous.gloss: demanding strict attention to rules and procedures

riming.gloss: having corresponding sounds especially terminal sounds

riotous.gloss: produced or growing in extreme abundance
characterized by unrest or disorder or insubordination

ripe.gloss: fully developed or matured and ready to be eaten or used
most suitable or right for a particular purpose

ripped.gloss: stupefied or excited by a chemical substance (especially alcohol)

ripping.gloss: resembling a sound of violent tearing as of something ripped apart or lightning splitting a tree

rippled.gloss: uneven by virtue of having wrinkles or waves
shaken into waves or undulations as by wind

risk-free.gloss: thought to be devoid of risk

riskless.gloss: thought to be devoid of risk

riveting.gloss: capable of arousing and holding the attention

richly.gloss: to an ample degree or in an ample manner
in a rich and lavish manner

ridiculously.gloss: so as to arouse or deserve laughter

right along.gloss: all the time or over a period of time

right away.gloss: at once (usually modifies an undesirable occurrence)

right smart.gloss: to a great degree or by a great distance

riotously.gloss: in a tumultuous and riotous manner
